title: Blockchain powered banking
description: 世界には銀行口座を持たない成人が17億人以上いると言われています。このうちアフリカは17％を占めています。

f6_assessments.q0:
Whilst a well functioning blockchain banking system would be good for Africans, its not clear this proposal has a clear plan on how it would execute it.
The proposer has submitted the same proposal 5 times (3 times in the developer ecosystem, once in grow Africa and once in NFT business models).
f6_assessments.q1:
No real plan has been presented and a statement that "We have developed and tested a cryptocurrency exchange platform that can be accessed on Android, iPhone, and web browesr." doesn't mean much without evidence. Each of the 5 proposals submitted has some small change in this experience. If they had done them all, why not add all of them to every proposal?

What are the regulatory hurdles? Which countries will you bank?

How are you going to market the project? 100,000 demo users in 3 months? Why do you think you can achieve this?
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has given deliverables, timelines and numbers of users and in that sense progress would be easy to audit. But what exactly is the app they will deliver going to do? Though the numbers seem to be too high to be achievable (100,000 demo users in 3 months with no marketing plan?).
f6_assessments.reply: The project is already implemented. A cryptocurrency exchange that has the functionality of sending and receiving money between users, more add-ons like accepting and processing payments online, developers portal, sandbox environment to be available once it gets funded. Project URL: https://pilot.ennarea.com. There are more than 300 million cryptocurrency users and traders worldwide. 100,000 demo users can be achieved in a few days only in Ethiopia. This number can be even bigger in the entire continent. This is going to be the first African-based cryptocurrency and blockchain-powered banking that will highly impact the finical system of the continent. Each proposal addresses different solutions and requires an adequate budget to operate the business successfully.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a very lean proposal that presented a problem but the solution seem not to address the problem.
It is hard to justify the proposed solution as it tries to recreate what is already available on publicly available crypto wallets.
The proposal fails to distinguish this proposed wallet from the publicly available  crypto wallets.
The proposal Solution is targeted to Africans who have a smartphone and can purchase data to use which is the minority of sub-Saharan Africans. The proposed solution will be well suited for developed countries and not Africa speaking as an African who have developed and managed the 2nd Largest Airtime micro-credit lending service for Airtel Nigeria(https://airtel.com.ng/pay_and_recharge/airtime/borrow_airtime) for 7 years and analysing daily airtime recharge/ banking data of over 40 Million Nigerians .
I strongly disagree.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal have not provided verifiable experience with links.
The proposal implementation plan lacks in-depth details on milestone and cost breakdown considering the requested amount of $200000.
I strongly disagree.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal did not provide sufficient information to help audit the progress of the Solution .
The proposal will require more research and in-depth details.

I strongly disagree.
f6_assessments.reply: The problem is already solved. A cryptocurrency exchange that has the functionality of sending and receiving money between users, more add-ons like accepting and processing payments online, developers portal, sandbox environment to be available once it gets funded. Project URL: https://pilot.ennarea.com. Banking should be free of worries like losing money while sending and transferring between clients. The available crypto wallets operate at owners' risk, money lost can not be refunded. Sending and receiving money will be simpler with our bank using phone numbers, email, account numbers, and username. Our experience is presented with evidence.

f6_assessments.q0: Banking the unbank in Africa can be good idea. This proposal can be a good fit in this challenge. My concern is that the proposer doesn't mention if the plateform is built on the cardano ecosystem.  That's an important point missing on this proposal. The proposer also didn't mention the value it's plateform will add to the cardano ecosystem. But the goal stated in this proposal align with this challenge. If this proposal gets funded, it can scale with next funds.
f6_assessments.q1: Althought the proposer has provided a link of the plateform built, the proposal is missing critical informations about the team and the skills of its members. There isn't, also, any mention of the skills needed for the execution of this project. I can see that the budget is no broken down accordingly as there is a lack of precision on  bugets items. This proposal also lacks a detailed plan for this and potential additional funds. Overall, this proposal is missing some critical information that can allow me to judge its implemention. I suggest to the proposer to add the necessary informations such as  comprehensible plan of action, a price roadmap and better budget breakdown.
f6_assessments.q2: Although this proposal contains KPIs, they are not well documented. I would suggest to add a brief model of a user acquisition strategy. Plus, a roadmap is missing in this proposal. Adding one can be very beneficial to this proposal. The problem and the solution on this proposal are pretty understandable. The problem that I see, is a detail plan that can lead to the success of this project.

f6_assessments.q0:
Serve people who are not banked in Africa is a real solution to the challenge of having a high number of African people who  don't have access to the bank. Providing them with a tool that would solve that problem, will be beneficial to those served communities.
This proposal is one of those solution through the Ennarea that will be used as a blockchain-powered bank.
As it's presented, It addresses the challenge mentioned in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
The feasibility of this proposal is also related to the experience of proposers in blockchain ecosystem development . This may be demonstrated through the platform that has already been developed, the Ennarea, but there's no mention of who are behind that platform in terms of experience, expertise and collaboration.
Background in finances would also be necessary to have when developing such a project as bank regulations are different in each country, and this may have an influence on how the project will be developed in each country where the project will be implemented.
Even though the goal of this project is worthy, but it's still necessary for any reader of this proposal to understand how it'll be implemented. Which from my perspective it's missing. As a big project of two hundred thousand dollars, it would be reasonable to start gradually by phase, and with a target of a specific country, after what an evaluation of the pilot project will be conducted and from the outcome and learnings, try to expand by adjusting what didn't work well on that stage.
The budget is not detailed, and a big portion is allocated to the salary of Senior Developers. That creates an imbalance in the budget.
Strategy of reaching out to the users is not not demonstrated, knowing it's a key factor for the success of this project.
f6_assessments.q2:
The success of this proposal is related to a lot of factors : experience, expertise of proposers; by-in from users; management of the financial aspect of it; area in Africa where the implementation process will start from. All these conditions present risks that are not described through all this proposal.
I would encourage the proposers to present more information about this great idea, eventually in the next funding cycle (catalyst 7)

f6_assessments.q0: This is a great proposal and one that can bring change and mass adoption to the Cardano blockchain and the guiding principle of Cardano. If achieved would be a great success in the ecosystem and one tha can revolutionize the space.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience is presented with evidence and access to the test pilot. The potential is positive but more clarity and plan on how this will audited in regards of progress. Kpis and funding explanation os there but is brief, where is the office situated and how the funds are broken down as per tasks in development could help the case. Also what are the legal issues you may encounter and how are the governmental and societal partnership required to issue this type of services are looked at in this project. How are the person using the product authenticated and how would this protect their interests.
f6_assessments.q2: There are some KPIs and timeline for auditing but is brief and detached for the amount of funding requested.

solution: Ennareaは、モバイルプラットフォームを通じてサービスにアクセスできるようにすることで、銀行口座を持たないアフリカのほとんどの人々にとって、ブロックチェーンを活用した銀行としての役割を果たします。
experience: 私たちは、Android、iPhone、Webブラウザでアクセス可能な暗号通貨交換プラットフォームを開発し、テストしました。
